summary:
Over 20 years of work experience in working public service, Training, project/programme management by UN, IFI and government as project/programme manager/director/coordinator. Proven ability to lead complex projects/programmes in challenging environments with multi-functional teams at local, regional and international levels. Thrives on new challenges within a culturally diverse environment. Strong commitment to delivering a high quality of services. Has a successful track record of meeting tight deadlines, targets, working under pressure, building networks with partners and stakeholder management.

Core Competencies:

Innovation: 
Ability to make new and useful ideas work; Creates new and relevant ideas and leads others to implement them

Leadership: 
Ability to persuade others to follow; Plans and acts transparently, actively works to remove barriers

People Management: 
Ability to improve performance and satisfaction; Models high professional standards and motivates excellence in others

Communication: 
Ability to listen, adapt, persuade and transform; Gains trust of peers, partners, and clients by presenting complex concepts in practical terms to others

Delivery: 
Ability to get things done while exercising good judgement; Critically assesses value and relevance of existing policy/practice and contributes to enhanced delivery of products, services, and innovative solutions

Technical/Functional Competencies:
Building strategic partnerships; Resource Mobilization; Maintaining information and databases; Promoting organizational learning and knowledge sharing; Knowledge of processes, guidelines and procedures; Promoting organizational change and development ;Design and implementation of management systems;
Client orientation; Promoting accountability and results-based management.

profile_positions.description:
The Somalia Strengthening Institutions for Public Works Project (SSIPWP) is a multi-stakeholder initiative to foster the capacity of the Federal Ministry of Public Works, Reconstruction and Housing (MPWRH), State-level Ministries ministries of public works, and Benadir Regional Administration (BRA)/the capital city of Somalia. Project funded by the African Development Bank (AfDB).
The project objectives are to enable infrastructure institutions to independently plan, develop, manage and maintain the physical infrastructure of the country; by developing more effective, efficient, accountable and inclusive institutions. After the project, these Ministries will be better positioned to deliver much-needed infrastructure and services to all Somalis.
profile_positions.title: Project Director

profile_positions.description:
Development of strategic leadership for the Ministry to that end designed the first Consolidated projects document as a long term strategic document for the ministry to focus on and strategic plan of 2014.
Worked as the lead coordinator of the ministry in its dealings with all members of the international community ranging from bilateral donors, international financing institutions such as the World Bank and AfDB as well as Multilateral partners such as UN, EU & other donor countries in the development of coordinated mechanism and policy on infrastructure development in Somalia.
In this role as coordinator, I also acted as the Peace and Stability Goals (PSG) 4 Lead for Infrastructure development, where I developed a deep knowledge and practice of the New Deal Compact for Somalia.
Further co-chaired with AfDB and later on with the government of Italy and Germany the Somali's infrastructure development pillar work-group. 
Furthermore, I coordinated the Transport Sector Needs Assessment (TSNA) for Somalia, carried out by the AfDB and subsequent prioritization process leading to pipeline projects between Federal Government of Somalia, Federal Member State, international donors, IFIs and friendly countries of Somalia.
